intro: Pterigeron dentatifolius, commonly known as the toothed-leaf pterigeron, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, serrated leaves and showy, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its unique leaf morphology and vibrant floral display make it a notable species in botanical gardens and conservation efforts. It is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
